highlights.sentence: Bianca's clinical focus includes eating disorders, addiction, anxiety, depression, and relationships.

statementSentences.sentence: Bianca VonBank, LPMFT holds a Bachelors in Psychology from Arizona State University and a Masters in Clinical Psychology from Antioch University, Santa Barbara.
Bianca's clinical focus includes eating disorders, addiction, anxiety, depression, and relationships.
As a result of her training, Bianca's approach is influenced by DBT, CBT, Mindfulness and Behavioral techniques.
Through her varied work experiences, Bianca developed an expertise in and deep passion for Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT).

She has been extensively trained by Behavioral Tech, LLC has completed the DBT Foundational Training, Adapting Your DBT Program for Substance Use Disorders, Skills Training in Dialectical Behavior Therapy, and The DBT Approach to Couples Therapy.

After completing her graduate studies, Bianca ran the Youth Evaluation and Treatment Centers' (Phoenix, AZ) intensive outpatient program for adolescents struggling with eating disorders, worked at Center For Discovery's (La Habra, CA) residential program and at The Beacon Program (New York, NY)

statementSentences.sentence: Hippocrates stated: "it is more important to know what person the disease has than what disease the person has".
Each individual presents unique issues that require tailored, collaborative treatment.
A practicing physician for over twenty years, I have dedicated my life to helping individuals balance their mental and physical well-being.
My practice and Integrative Center for Wellness focus on incorporating psychiatric treatments with nutritional therapies to calibrate balance between mind and body.

With expertise in bipolar disorder, depression, anxiety, ADHD, stuttering and weight management, among others, treatment modalities include psychotherapy, medication, exercise, wellness and nutrition counseling.
Anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, overeating, stress and many other issues result from a combination of biological and environmental factors.

Careful, thorough evaluation and a holistic approach -- knowing the person at the core, individualizing treatment, and integrating behavioral, psychiatric and nutritional modalities - are critical to successful management of many diagnoses.
Mental disorders are associated with significant stigma.
I help patients decipher myth from the facts and how best to deal with them.
I formulate a comprehensive treatment addressing concerns about medications, dependence, and long-term effects.
For more information, please visit www.samoonmd.com.

highlights.sentence: I am a licensed psychotherapist specializing in the treatment of depression, anxiety, eating disorders, trauma and addiction as well as relationship and family conflicts.
In addition to my long-term practice in New York City, I have had a second office in Princeton, New Jersey since 2012.

statementSentences.sentence: I am a licensed psychotherapist specializing in the treatment of depression, anxiety, eating disorders, trauma and addiction as well as relationship and family conflicts.
From a psychodynamic approach, I help my patients to not only focus on reducing symptoms, but also explore and heal the underlying issues and emotional origins of their presenting concerns.
When indicated or requested, I can refer and facilitate additional treatment with qualified psychiatrists, nutritionists and other mental health and medical experts.
In addition to my long-term practice in New York City, I have had a second office in Princeton, New Jersey since 2012.
After receiving my MSW from Columbia University, I was a therapist at the Renfrew Center of New York, receiving specialized training in the treatment of eating disorders.

Additionally, I completed post-graduate training in Psychodynamic Psychotherapy from NYU Medical Center's Psychoanalytic Institute and worked as a therapist at Weill Cornell's Employee Assistance Program.
I would be happy to arrange a consultation with you at either of my locations and look forward to helping you create meaningful and fulfilling life changes.

statementSentences.sentence: Dr. Sultan is an Emory, Columbia and Cornell trained Psychiatrist.

He is experienced in a wide range of treatments including: psychoanalytic therapy, cognitive behavior therapy, dialectical behavioral therapy, family therapy, supportive treatment, and psychopharmacology.

Each of these treatments has advantages and disadvantages, and while this might seem overwhelming to newcomers, Dr. Sultan believes in working with patients to create the most comfortable and effective treatment for each individual.

His extensive experience with a diverse range patient with varied symptoms, severities, and conditions allows him to be an excellent resource for customizing the right treatment for each of his patients.

highlights.sentence: In my clinical practice, I take a predominantly cognitive-behavioral approach and integrate mindfulness and acceptance-based treatments.
I also specialize in treating General Anxiety Disorder, Panic Disorder, Phobias, Social Anxiety and mood disorders.
Additionally, my clinical interests include treatments for eating disorders and body image concerns, parenting skills training, as well as relational conflict and interpersonal challenges.

statementSentences.sentence: In my clinical practice, I take a predominantly cognitive-behavioral approach and integrate mindfulness and acceptance-based treatments.
My approach is goal-oriented and skills-focused to empower individuals to live more satisfying, values-driven lives.
I place particular importance on establishing a trusting and collaborative partnership to foster a strong therapeutic alliance.
My clinical specialty is treatment for Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD), including the purely obsessional subtype, Pure-O.
I was trained by a world renowned expert utilizing Exposure and Response Prevention techniques.
I also specialize in treating General Anxiety Disorder, Panic Disorder, Phobias, Social Anxiety and mood disorders.
Additionally, my clinical interests include treatments for eating disorders and body image concerns, parenting skills training, as well as relational conflict and interpersonal challenges.
I utilize techniques from Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) and Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) to work with those experiencing difficulty regulating emotions.
My research background has primarily focused on Body Dysmorphic Disorder and other body image distortions.
At present, I am also an adjunct professor at Brooklyn College.

highlights.sentence: Specializing in DBT, Anya has had success in the treatment of patients suffering from borderline personality disorder, post traumatic stress disorder, eating disorders, anxiety, depression and substance abuse as well as those known to exhibit extreme mood swings, self-injurious behaviors, emotional dysregulation and phobias.
She has held positions at both Mount Sinai and Bronx Lebanon Hospitals giving her in depth experience with patients dealing with depression, anxiety and addiction.

statementSentences.sentence: Specializing in DBT, Anya has had success in the treatment of patients suffering from borderline personality disorder, post traumatic stress disorder, eating disorders, anxiety, depression and substance abuse as well as those known to exhibit extreme mood swings, self-injurious behaviors, emotional dysregulation and phobias.

statementSentences.sentence: I am a medical psychiatrist and psychotherapist specializing in both psychopharmacology and therapy.

I turn to the evidence base and science to provide my patients with personalized treatment plans, taking into account their preferences along with my clinical assessment of what can benefit them the most.
In designing a unique and tailored plan for each of my patients, I apply the biopsychosocial model, viewing each patient as a multidimensional human being.
The forefront of my treatment method is attunement to interactions between the body and mind.
I have expertise in treating Depression, Anxiety, Panic Disorders, Adult ADHD, and OCD.

highlights.sentence: She completed an internship in clinical psychology/neuropsychology, a fellowship in cognitive rehabilitation, and a three-year postdoctoral fellowship in neuropsychology.

statementSentences.sentence: Dr. Couvadelli is an adult and pediatric Neuropsychologist/Psychologist with areas of expertise in clinical neuropsychology, cognitive rehabilitation and health psychology.
Dr. Couvadelli obtained her PhD in Behavioral Medicine with a focus on Cognitive Neuroscience.
She completed an internship in clinical psychology/neuropsychology, a fellowship in cognitive rehabilitation, and a three-year postdoctoral fellowship in neuropsychology.
In addition she has obtained a medical degree from Greece.

Dr. Couvadelli has served as the head of Pediatric Neuropsychology at JFK Medical Center, NJ and she holds the appointment of Assistant Professor of Neuroscience at Seton Hall University School of Health/Medical Sciences.

Due to her unique background, Dr. Couvadelli can assess a variety of neurological, psychological and learning disorders (e.g.autism, ADHD, epilepsy, traumatic brain injury, brain tumors, dementia, depression, anxiety, insomnia, dyslexia etc) and in turn develop targeted intervention and treatment plans to ensure attainment of optimum life functioning.
In addition, Dr. Couvadelli has expertise in treating mood disorders (anxiety, depression, bipolar), insomnia, social and behavioral issues.

statementSentences.sentence: Manhattan Institute for Psychoanalysis, founded in 1980 and chartered by the New York State Board of Regents links people to psychoanalytically trained Manhattan Institute graduates and candidates.

statementSentences.sentence: Dr. DeSarbo is a Board Certified psychitrist with 70% of his practice in the treatment of EATING DISORDERS with the remaining 30% for general psychiatry.
